text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires noting that the Belgian officers had reason to believe the Spanish vessel was not complying with the Convention. The candidate answer explicitly states in Section 1, point 1, that Belgian officers observed that fishing lines were 'not marked in accordance with Article 5 (Annex IV),' and later confirms in Section 3, point 5, that the request for information about un-marked gear was the minimal step required to verify compliance with Art. 5. This directly satisfies the requirement that the officers had a reasonable basis (unmarked gear) for their actions.", "criterion_id": "criterion 4"}
